---
title: "DS protocol"
---

Between May and October 2024, Jin Yong Park recorded from different cell types with the "DS_probe_protocol" in the G4 ephys setup. 

## Protocol overview 

- 3 repetitions of light and dark moving bars, edges, gratings and full field flashes.

________________________________

<b>Aim:</b> To characterise the direction selectivity and temporal frequency tuning of different cell types in Drosophila visual system.

<b>Bar stimuli</b> moving in multiple orientations - horizontal, vertical, and diagonal (45° and -45°) - presented at two different speeds (20 and 100 degrees per second). These bars come in two spatial sizes (2 and 6 pixels wide) and are shown in both standard and flipped (reverse contrast) versions.

<b>Edge stimuli</b> featuring ON and OFF edges moving horizontally and vertically, also presented in standard and reversed directions. These edge stimuli are designed to isolate responses to luminance boundaries.

<b>Grating stimuli</b> with 12-pixel spatial wavelength, oriented vertically, horizontally, and diagonally. These gratings are presented at multiple temporal frequencies ranging from 0.5 Hz up to 64 Hz, allowing characterization of temporal frequency tuning. Each grating orientation includes both standard and phase-flipped versions.

<b>Flash stimuli</b> presented at various temporal frequencies (0.5 Hz to 64 Hz) to examine responses to uniform field flicker without spatial structure.

<b>Pixel intensity values</b> The protocol's patterns are `gs_val` 4 (intensity values can be values between 0-15). The protocol first presents all dark stimuli (intensity 1/15) and then runs through all stimuli again with light stimuli (intensity 12/15). Each stimulus is presented for 3 repetitions.

## Code availability

The code for generating and analysing the DS_Probe_protocol can be found in this [repository](https://github.com/leburnett/DS_probe_protocol).

## Data availability

The data from these experiments can be found on the Reiser Lab prfs group drive in the folder `/Volumes/reiserlab/burnettl/Ephys_experiments/Jinyong/DS_probe_protocol_1REP_RightHemi_20Hz_05-22-24_09-09-09`.

## Notes 

In retrospect, we should have recorded from the T4T5 driver first (as these cells are well studied) to validate the protocol before moving on to the less well characterised TmY cell types. I would advise anyone wishing to continue with this project to start with T4T5 recordings to ensure the protocol is working as expected.
